page.title: 01Hole of Horcum Area
page.content: The southern edge of the heather moorland of the National Park of Scattersgate Brow escarpment and Hole of Horcum allow fantastic views of the moorlands to the north and forests to the west. The southern part of the block is given over to farmland as it gently decends again to the vale of Pickering. Characteristically large fields with no hedges; of grass & other crops, using the flatter, previously reclaimed moorland. Several small coniferous plantations between fields, and to the north east most residents are farmers. The A169 passes through the area so it is a very popular place to stop and enjoy the scenery. Walking is also popular and there is a good selection of footpaths. Vehicular access to the east side of the block is difficult, but again the spectacular scenery &
